title: Chancellor of the Exchequer
summary: The chancellor of the Exchequer,[lower-alpha 1] often abbreviated to the chancellor,[2] is a senior minister of the Crown within the Government of the United Kingdom, and the chief executive officer of Her Majesty's Treasury. As one of the four Great Offices of State, the chancellor is a high-ranking member of the British Cabinet and is third in the ministerial ranking, behind the prime minister and deputy prime minister.[3]
